channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: スポーツ・イラストレイテッド』誌の運営会社は、同誌の印刷版を5月をもって終了するとスタッフに伝えた。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Sports Illustrated's operators told staff the magazine would end its print edition after May; the message runs counter to owner Authentic Brands' earlier stance  —  Its operators made a newsroom announcement, but the outcome is uncertain since the owner has signaled it wants the magazine to endure.

item.title: TikTokに依存する中小企業の経営者や活動家は、売却や禁止を強制する米下院の措置は彼らの生活を損ない、地域社会にも悪影響を及ぼすと述べている（Taylor Lorenz/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Taylor Lorenz / Washington Post:
Small-business owners and activists who rely on TikTok say the US House measure forcing a sale or ban would damage their livelihoods and harm their communities  —  Small-business owners, community advocates and educators spoke out Wednesday after the House overwhelmingly approved a measure to ban the popular app

item.title: イランの裁判所、オスカー受賞監督アスガー・ファルハディの2021年作『A Hero』における元教え子からの盗作疑惑を晴らす（Nick Vivarelli/Variety）
item.description:
Nick Vivarelli / Variety:
An Iranian court clears Oscar-winning director Asghar Farhadi of accusations of plagiarism from a former student for his 2021 film A Hero  —  Two-time Oscar-winning director Asghar Farhadi has been fully cleared by an Iranian court of allegations of plagiarism pertaining to his film “A Hero” …

item.title: メモウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙、エレナ・チェルニー氏をシニア・エディターに任命、基準・倫理チームを率い、報道の自由と言論の自由を擁護（Chris Roush/Talking Biz News）
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
Memo: The Wall Street Journal names Elena Cherney as senior editor, leading the Standards and Ethics team and championing press freedom and free speech  —  Wall Street Journal editor in chief Emma Tucker sent out the following on Thursday:  —  Dear all,  —  I am delighted to announce …

item.title: ユニバーサルミュージックがPandoraのロイヤリティ支払いをSoundExchange経由の50%分配から、UMGから直接支払われるより少ない分配に変更、新人アーティストの収入に打撃（Steve Knopper/Billboard）
item.description:
Steve Knopper / Billboard:
Universal Music changed Pandora royalty payments from a 50% split via SoundExchange to often-smaller splits paid directly by UMG, hurting newer artists' revenue  —  The company is the only major label so far to change accounting for Pandora royalties since it introduced on-demand streaming.

item.title: スポティファイは欧州委員会に宛てた電子メールで、アップルが料金情報とサブスクリプションへのリンクを追加するiPhoneアプリのアップデートを保留していると述べている（Emma Roth/The Verge）。
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
In an email to the European Commission, Spotify says Apple is holding up an iPhone app update that adds pricing information and links to subscriptions  —  In an email to the European Commission obtained by The Verge, Spotify writes that Apple has “neither acknowledged nor responded to Spotify's submission” …

item.title: Pornhubは先週、連邦控訴裁判所がポルノサイトに年齢確認措置を義務付けるテキサス州法を支持したことを受け、テキサス州のユーザーへのアクセスをブロックした（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Pornhub blocks access to users in Texas, after a federal appeals court upheld a Texas law last week requiring porn sites to institute age-verification measures  —  Pornhub and other affiliated adult websites have blocked access to users in Texas, amid a legal battle with the Lone Star State's attorney general …

item.title: ガネットと契約し「広告コンテンツ」を提供しているアドバンテッジ・インフォマティクスは、ブライアン・ティンポーンのメトリック・メディアの「ピンクスライム」サイトと深いつながりがある（Steven Monacelli/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Steven Monacelli / Nieman Lab:
Advantage Informatics, which has a contract with Gannett to provide “advertorial content”, has deep ties to “pink slime” sites from Brian Timpone's Metric Media  —  An executive from a company associated with Metric Media was hired to teach journalism, but the story doesn't end there.

item.title: ウクライナのメディア開発財団幹部とのQ&A：戦時下におけるニュースの砂漠化の進行、人材雇用と収益の多様化の問題、その他（Jon Allsop/Columbia Journalism Review）
item.description:
Jon Allsop / Columbia Journalism Review:
Q&A with Ukraine's Media Development Foundation executives on increased news desertification in wartime, trouble hiring personnel and diversifying revenue, more  —  Two years ago last month, Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.  The consequences for the latter country's press …

item.title: 閉鎖されたメキシコの国営通信社ノティメックスの元従業員たちが、労働者協同組合として運営されるメキシコ情報協会を立ち上げる（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Ex-employees of Mexico's shuttered state news agency, Notimex, launch the Mexican Association of Information, which will operate as a worker cooperative  —  Mexico's president, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, had said last year that there no need for a state news agency since he conducts daily press briefings.

item.title: FCC、ケーブル・衛星テレビ事業者に対し、広告や請求書に地域スポーツ番組の料金を含む総額表示を義務付ける規則を採択（Todd Shields/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Todd Shields / Bloomberg:
The FCC adopts a rule requiring cable and satellite TV providers to show the total price in ads and bills, including fees for regional sports programming  —  - Consumer charges have been targeted under President Biden  — Cable industry calls rule unneeded and costly to implement

item.title: 昨年テオ・ヴォンらポッドキャスターから支払い遅延を指摘されたカスト・メディア、連邦破産法第11章を申請 負債は630万ドル以上（Jonathan Randles/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Jonathan Randles / Bloomberg:
Kast Media, which was accused by Theo Von and other podcasters last year of missing payments, files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, listing $6.3M+ in liabilities  —  - Podcast producer Kast Media filed Chapter 11 after accusations  — Comedian Theo Von is owed $456,398, according to filing

item.title: Reddit、広告主が最大限のエンゲージメントを獲得できるよう、ユーザーによる投稿に似ているが "Promoted "ラベルが付いた広告フォーマット、フリーフォーム広告を開始（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
Reddit launches free-form ads, an ad format that looks similar to posts made by users, but with a “Promoted” label, to help advertisers get maximum engagement  —  Reddit is introducing a new ad format that looks similar to posts made by users on the platform, the company announced on Thursday.

item.title: パレスチナ解放を求める公開書簡に署名して解雇されたデイヴィッド・ヴェラスコの後任として、アートフォーラムがティナ・リヴァース・ライアンを編集長に指名（Zachary Small/New York Times）
item.description:
Zachary Small / New York Times:
Artforum names Tina Rivers Ryan as its editor-in-chief to replace David Velasco, who was fired after signing an open letter calling for Palestinian liberation  —  The curator and essayist will become the magazine's next leader after a period of turmoil.  —  Artforum named Tina Rivers Ryan …
